GROWTH Replicator, provides all healthcare stakeholders free access to a platform for the replication of systematic evidence reviews. Doctor Evidence’s (DRE) GROWTH Replicator enables users to utilize DRE’s proprietary platform and Digital Outcome Conversion (DOC) technology to reproduce reviews, and provides an open access interface for the published methods and data of a review. Through GROWTH Replicator, Doctor Evidence is providing an ecosystem where scientists and methodologists can communicate in an open forum by testing, iterating, investigating, and replicating an evidence review Read press release. The first review tested by GROWTH Replicator was recently conducted by the Institute for Clinical and Economic Review (ICER) on Multiple Myeloma.
Scientists can enroll without cost to use the DRE platform, a protected login site, to view the underlying data used in this review. GROWTH REPLICATOR ICER Multiple Myeloma Forum

Doctor Evidence was pleased to present an interactive innovations showcase on the DRE ontology management system as part of AcademyHealth's Annual Research Meeting (ARM) in Boston, MA on Monday, June 27, 2016.
For more than 30 years, AcademyHealth's Annual Research Meeting (ARM) has been the premier forum for health services research, where more than 2,400 attendees gather to discuss health policy implications, sharpen research methods, and network with colleagues from around the world.
